title: Deutsche Bank in Late 2016 Raced to Shed Loan It Made to Russian Bank VTB
summary: German lender sold a chunk of the loan to Russian financial institution Alfa Bank but Citigroup took a pass, documents and people familiar with the matter indicate. Deutsche Bank AG , seeking to slash its exposure to Russia in late 2016, scrambled to shed a $600 million loan it had outstanding to VTB Group, a large Russian state-owned bank, according to documents and people familiar with the funding.

title: Venezuelans Take to the Streets to Protest Maduro
summary: The president remained defiant in a speech before a crowd of a few thousand supporters. CARACAS, Venezuela-Tens of thousands of people who want to see President Nicolás Maduro removed from power swarmed the streets of this capital and other cities Saturday, as an air force general announced he had turned against the authoritarian government.

title: Trump Organization Was Rebuffed for Loan by Deutsche Bank in 2016
summary: Deutsche bank raised questions internally about whether it had enough information about the use of the funds, according to people familiar with the matter. Deutsche Bank AG rebuffed a request from the Trump Organization in March 2016 to increase a loan for the Trump National Doral, a Florida golf resort, because of concerns about expanding the bank's relationship with then-candidate Donald Trump or his company, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How Tom Brady Tops 'The Big Bang Theory'
summary: The Patriots quarterback's eight previous Super Bowl appearances have averaged 100.1 million viewers. A look at how that compares with television's most popular sitcom.. Tom Brady will play in his ninth Super Bowl and that is the primary argument his supporters use to crown him the King of Quarterbacks. But his nearly annual appearance on the world's biggest stage might also make Brady the King of Television.

title: Virginia Governor to Speak About Racist Photo Amid Calls for Him to Resign
summary: Democrat Ralph Northam apologized shortly after picture in his 1984 medical school yearbook surfaced. Virginia Democratic Gov. Ralph Northam apologized Friday for appearing in a racist photograph in his 1984 medical yearbook that showed one person dressed in blackface and another in a Ku Klux Klan hood and robe.

title: As EPA Eases Wetlands Rule, California Makes Countermove
summary: State speeds up plans to bolster protections, frustrating home builders. Home builders cheered a Trump administration move in December to ease environmental regulations on development in wetlands. But in California, the celebration didn't last long.

title: Apple Doesn't Buy Low
summary: iPhone maker shut off buybacks as shares cratered late last year. Don't accuse Apple Inc. of trying to prop up its own stock.

title: In 'High Flying Bird,' Athletes Maneuver Off the Court
summary: André Holland stars in the Netflix movie, written by Tarell Alvin McCraney and directed by Steven Soderbergh. In "High Flying Bird," a sports agent tries to maneuver his star client around an NBA lockout, but according to director Steven Soderbergh, "there actually isn't any sports in it."

title: How to Skip the Crowds at Big Museum Shows
summary: Museum officials offer advice on how to navigate growing hordes at blockbuster shows. Museums around the world beckon with blockbuster shows on Warhol, van Gogh and Monet. But tickets for particular admission times sell out swiftly online and often deliver visitors to packed galleries. What's the best way to see the actual show-and not just the back of people's heads?

title: Debunking the Myths About Male Sexuality
summary: Long-held stereotypes contend that men are always interested in sex, happiest being the pursuer and focused solely on the physical. A new book disagrees.. What do men secretly want?

title: In a Sign of Democrats' Challenge, Brown Faces Skepticism From Iowa Farmers
summary: Ohio senator has criticized Trump's trade policies with China as damaging to U.S. farmers. PERRY, Iowa-Democratic Sen. Sherrod Brown, considering a run for president in 2020, is finding resistance from some Iowa farmers as he tries to sell his message that President Trump's trade policies are helping steelworkers at their expense.

title: Super Bowl LIII: The Science Behind the Play Sheet
summary: Rams coach Sean McVay uses a modest sheet to call plays, while other coaches around the league opt for the 'Jersey diner menu'. ATLANTA-At some point during Super Bowl LIII, the television cameras will zero in on Rams coach Sean McVay on the sideline. He'll most likely be relaying a play call to quarterback Jared Goff, using his play sheet to cover his mouth.

title: Japanese Tycoon Plans to Fly With SpaceX, but His Latest Projects Have Failed to Launch
summary: Yusaku Maezawa bought the first ticket to fly to the moon with Elon Musk's SpaceX but on Earth his company is no longer soaring. TOKYO-The Japanese billionaire who bought the first ticket to fly around the moon on Elon Musk's SpaceX vehicle is losing momentum back on Earth.

title: The NFL's Play Callers
summary: Coaches across the league with their play sheets. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: His Top Fitness Challenge: Dodge the Charging Moose
summary: A Seattle professor takes his cross-country skiing up a notch by avoiding the groomed trails everyone else uses. Some people use music or a workout buddy to push them faster. Jonathan Karpoff gets his extra boost from avoiding wild animals.

title: 'Quiet Signs' by Jessica Pratt Review: Emptiness Filled With Emotion
summary: On Jessica Pratt's new album, hushed acoustic songs with minimal arrangements are haunted by loss..

title: Women Claim New Turf on Wall Street
summary: Women are managing billions of dollars and beating male competitors in the booming CLO market. Women are fueling the growth of one of the most popular products on Wall Street, the $700 billion market for collateralized loan obligations.

title: Why the Fed Made a U-Turn: Perceived Risks Shifted
summary: Fed Chairman Jerome Powell sets aside the central bank's key framework. The Federal Reserve reversed course earlier this past week when it put interest rate rises on hold, prompted by rising risks to U.S. growth in the months ahead, rather than any signs the economy's health is faltering now.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Who's in the Atlanta Falcons Owner's Huddle?
summary: Much like when he ran Home Depot. Arthur Blank looks for blunt feedback, including from James Dimon. Owner of the Atlanta Falcons

title: Over 60, and Crushed by Student Loan Debt
summary: Older Americans are struggling under the burden of student loans-their children's and their own.. One generation of Americans owed $86 billion in student loan debt at last count. Its members are all 60 years old or more.

title: Apple's Cold War Over Privacy Turns Hot
summary: Consumers get caught in the crossfire in tech giants' power battle. Apple Inc. delivered a disciplinarian smack to two of its biggest rivals this week. Facebook Inc. and Google soon won a reprieve, but it's unlikely to end there.

title: Imperial Oil Rolls Back U.S.-Bound Exports, Citing Surge in Cost
summary: Exxon Mobil's Canadian unit is cutting the amount of oil it ships by rail from the province of Alberta. Exxon Mobil Corp.'s Canadian unit Imperial Oil Ltd. is scaling back the amount of U.S.-bound oil it ships by rail from the province of Alberta to nearly zero this month.

title: Warren Accepts Cherokee View of DNA's Role in Tribe Citizenship
summary: Democrat's initial online donations in presidential bid fall short of those of Sen. Kamala Harris, FEC report shows. WASHINGTON-Sen. Elizabeth Warren apologized to a Native American group that criticized her release of a genetic test last year that showed she likely had Native American ancestry, the tribal group said.

title: Evangelist's Account Spurred Stone to Seek Clinton Emails From WikiLeaks
summary: Trump campaign adviser sought corroboration for Indian's allegations against Hillary Clinton. Less than two months before the 2016 election, longtime Trump adviser Roger Stone sent an email request to a radio show host who had recently interviewed WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange: Get information from Mr. Assange about Hillary Clinton's alleged role in the Libyan civil war in August 2011.

title: Roof's Take: Clouds Cast Shadow on L.A.'s Startup Scene
summary: Investors acknowledge the script for Hollywood's startup ecosystem is still a work in progress. The Upfront Ventures' summit, which wrapped up on Thursday, proved to be the rare conference in which the audience's star power rivals the guests on stage, which included actors Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Gwyneth Paltrow, and Duff McKagan from Guns N' Roses.

title: U.S. to Withdraw From Cold War-Era Nuclear Treaty With Russia
summary: America's exit sets up the development of new missiles to counter China's military. The U.S. said it plans to withdraw from a 1987 nuclear treaty with Russia, setting up potential development of new missiles to counter China, current and former American officials said, and a fresh debate about Washington's military posture in the Pacific.

title: Judge Dismisses Maryland Lawsuit Challenging Trump on Health-Law Enforcement, Whitaker Appointment
summary: Judge rules that state didn't have standing since Trump administration is still enforcing Affordable Care Act for now. A federal judge on Friday dismissed a lawsuit by the state of Maryland that sought to preserve the Affordable Care Act and raised a prominent challenge to President Trump's appointment of Matthew Whitaker as acting attorney general.
